meanings.definition: The quality or state of being eutrophic.
meanings.sent1: The eutrophy of the lake was evident from the abundance of algae and plant growth.
meanings.sent2: The eutrophy of the soil allowed for lush vegetation to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The eutrophy of the garden soil made the plants so happy they practically sang!
meanings.sent4: The eutrophy of the ecosystem was like a symphony of life, each organism playing its part.
meanings.sent5: The eutrophy of the environment painted a vibrant picture of biodiversity.

meanings.sent1: The eutrophy of the pond was a slow but steady transformation.
meanings.sent2: The eutrophy of the river was influenced by various factors over time.
meanings.sent3: The eutrophy of the garden soil was like watching a captivating dance of nutrients.
meanings.sent4: The eutrophy of the field was a gradual shift towards a more fertile state.
meanings.sent5: The eutrophy of the lake was a fascinating journey of nutrient enrichment.
